page.title: 06POLICEWORK IN CUMNOCK (1)
page.content:
A policeman's work usually begins by finding out what went on during the previous shift as he might have to follow up such enquiries. If there is nothing to complete, they are instructed to attend to new enquiries. These duties can vary from attending to found property such as a stray dog, a slight, serious or fatal road accident to non-suspicious sudden deaths and even murder. Most serious crimes such as a large theft, house breaking and murders are dealt with by CID. Sometimes a policeman has to be in court to give evidence in a case.
Public co-operation plays an important part in a policeman's job. Visits to schools and other organisations, help spread public awareness of the role of the police. {
